title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 826.12 - Zone of Rate Freedom
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 826.12 - Zone of Rate Freedom

State Regulations
(a) A common
carrier of property or a common carrier of household goods may increase or
decrease each individual rate or all rates or a group of rates by percentages
not to exceed 10 percent in any 12-month period. (b) This section does not apply to the
collective actions of the members of a rate organization when such actions
apply to more than one carrier. (c) The department cannot suspend any rate proposal that complies with this
section, providing that such change is filed with the department on not less
than 30 days' notice and complies with all other applicable rules and
regulations of the department. (d) A letter of transmittal must accompany every filing under this section and
contain the following information: (1)
that
the filing is submitted under the provisions of the Zone of Rate Freedom (17
NYCRR
826.12
); (2)
that the
proposed rates were last changed on [insert date]; and
(3)
that the supplement number or tariff
number that contained the last change was [insert number reference]. (e) Any filing proposal that will
result in an increase or decrease in excess of 10 percent during any 12-month
period must be accompanied by the statement required in section
826.6
(a)(4)
of
this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
826.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
